title: Xhosa people
summary: Xhosa people (/ˈkɔːsə, ˈkoʊsə/;[2][3] Xhosa pronunciation: [kǁʰɔ́ːsa] (listen)) are a Nguni ethnic group in Southern Africa whose homeland is primarily within the modern-day Eastern Cape. There is a small but significant Xhosa-speaking (Mfengu) community in Zimbabwe, and their language, isiXhosa, is recognised as a national language.[4]
